channel.title: [Class Suggestion] Librarian/Book Keeper
channel.description:
Librarian (BD Social)
Day Ability 1: Loan Book - Select two players. One will be able to see the others log book tonight.
Unlimited Uses
Night Ability 1: Snoop - Take a copy of a players log book and keep it. (Cannot target King)
2 Uses
Night Ability 2: Writing Review - See what a player added to their log book tonight and only what they added. (You will not see their full logs)
Unlimited Uses
Book Keeper (Unseen Social)
Day Ability 1: Book Thief - Select a player and let all the unseen see it tonight. (Cannot be used on King)
2 Uses
Night Ability 1: Libel - Frame a player tonight.
Unlimited Uses
Night Ability 2: Book Swap - Swap your logbook with a player that dies tonight.
2 Uses
Comments: This class would be great for helping with giving logs out to important BD classes. The writing review could also let you socially deduce if someone does not update their logs at night they might seem more suspicious. The snoop ability was nice to have for noble but not totally sure if its needed but I felt they needed a second night ability. The unseen converted class is nice too it will help them find the prince and possibly get all the claims he has. I've also noticed when someone dies and their logs and class don't match BD goes on an exe spree on all the physician claims thinking theres a herbalist, but the book swap could help with that or you can edit that pesky sheriff's logs that found an unseen to make his logs different when he dies.

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Librarian/Book Keeper
item.dc:creator: Geyde
item.description:
Henry_Voss:

Day Ability 1:
Loan Book - Select two players. One will be able to see the others log book tonight.

Too easily confirmable.

Henry_Voss:

Night Ability 1:
Snoop - Take a copy of a players log book and keep it. (Cannot target King)

Again, too easily confirmable. Also forcing claims out of evils early is not fair to play against.

Henry_Voss:

Night Ability 2:
Writing Review - See what a player added to their log book tonight and only what they added. (You will not see their full logs)

Too easily confirmable yet again.

Just to the note of the person that wrote this, reading / checking logs has been proven in the past to be fundamentally OP for a BD class.
